page.title: 09A Village Pub,Marton.
page.content: We visited a local village pub and found out how it is run.The pub was built in the 17th century. It sells soft drinks,sweets, off sales and a lot of bar meals as well as alcohol. Although it is a village pub 90% of the customers come from Coventry. Another function of this pub is the display in the bar of advertisments for local cricket games and charity functions.We were told that their busiest day was Saturday. They have a lot of foreign visitors because they advertise themselves on the main road as a 17th century inn. Custom in the summer is increased because of the outdoor facilities, which allow people to bring along their children.As a result of our visit we decided that although it was in a village it did not function as a village pub.
